intro: Vochya, commonly known as the "devil's lettuce," is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces small, edible leaves that are often used in traditional cuisine. Vochya thrives in cold, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of alpine flora.
